verses.verse: To the chief Musician,<WH5329> A Psalm of David,<WH1732> to bring to remembrance.<WH2142> Make haste, O God,<WH430> to deliver<WH5337> me; make haste<WH2363> to help<WH5833> me, O LORD.<WH3068>

Let them be ashamed<WH954> and confounded<WH2659> that seek after<WH1245> my soul:<WH5315> let them be turned<WH5472> backward,<WH268> and put to confusion,<WH3637> that desire<WH2655> my hurt.<WH7451>
Let them be turned back<WH7725> for<WH5921> a reward<WH6118> of their shame<WH1322> that say,<WH559> Aha,<WH1889> aha.<WH1889>

Let all<WH3605> those that seek<WH1245> thee rejoice<WH7797> and be glad<WH8055> in thee: and let such as love<WH157> thy salvation<WH3444> say<WH559> continually,<WH8548> Let God<WH430> be magnified.<WH1431>
But I<WH589> am poor<WH6041> and needy:<WH34> make haste<WH2363> unto me, O God:<WH430> thou<WH859> art my help<WH5828> and my deliverer;<WH6403> O LORD,<WH3068> make no<WH408> tarrying.<WH309>
